intro: Dysophylla benthamiana, commonly known as the Bentham's dysophylla, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves with a rough texture. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Dysophylla benthamiana is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions.
